isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PT PACER - 1992 - 1993 - DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: PT Pacer is an electronically-controlled road-speed governing system. System features include:

The PT Pacer system is a full-time electronic governor that receives power from fuse F4 whenever the ignition switch is in the "ON" position. It is available on Cummins L10 and N14 STC engines. STC engines are mechanically controlled engines as opposed to the CELECT electronically controlled engines.
The PT Pacer Control Unit (PCU) is the information processing unit for the system. It is also the storage center for the owner specified operation parameters.

The PCU receives information input from the tachometer and speedometer sensors, processes the information, and sends signals out to the Electric Fuel Control (EFC) valve. The EFC controls road speed by controlling the amount of fuel available to the fuel injectors.
The PT Pacer utilizes the standard Cummins L10 and N14 engine harnesses as well as standard International tachometer and speedometer sensors.
